text.__SUMMARY__: Viola brittoniana, common names coast violet, northern coastal violet and Britton's violet, is a rare, acaulescent blue-flowered violet that occurs on the greater coastal plain in New England. It has distinctive leaves with narrow lobes and deep sinuses. It is a perennial.
text.Conservation status in the United States:
It is listed as endangered in Connecticut  and Pennsylvania. It is listed as threatened in Massachusetts and as possibly extirpated in Maine.
